Class FileSystemManager

Constructors
FileSystemManager()
Methods
getFileSystems(): Iterable<FileSystem>
pickle(FileSystemEntity entity): String
register(FileSystem fileSytem): void
unpickle(String pickle): Future<FileSystemEntity>

The FileSystemManager class is used as a registry of all available file systems.

It is also able to serialize a FileSystemEntity into a string, and de-serialize it back again. This is useful for persisting references to files across sessions.

Constructors

FileSystemManager()

Methods

Iterable<FileSystem> getFileSystems()

Return the set of all available file systems.

String pickle(FileSystemEntity entity)

Serialize a file system entity to a string.

void register(FileSystem fileSytem)

Register a new FileSystem with the FileSystemManager. This is generally only called by file system implementations.

Future<FileSystemEntity> unpickle(String pickle)

Restore a file system entity from a string.
